Description: Small fragmentary limestone sundial. There are 12 grooves and a notch at the top of the piece that originally held the pointer or "Gnomon".
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), 'picked out of the rubbish'. 'Second Temple' (Petrie 1886)
Curator's comments: Petrie mentioned this find in his journal (Journal 1884-85, p. 191) 'a small limestone dial was picked out of the rubbish' in the Temple of Apollo area.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 16, pl. XVIII, no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CG.03)
